alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Carroll (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 12 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Maryland and northern Maryland, including the following counties: in north central Maryland, Carroll. In northern Maryland, Baltimore. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy showers and thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Randallstown... Owings Mills... Eldersburg... Reisterstown... Oakland... Garrison... Glyndon... Mcdonogh... Carrolltowne... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
